Key Match Events: Ryan Christie finally broke the deadlock with an emphatic finish after 58 minutes.

A spectacular volley from substitute Che Adams five minutes from time gave the scoreline a more acceptable sheen and enhanced the strikerâ€™s claims for a start against Germany ahead of Lawrence Shankland.
Pre-Game Insights: Scotland boss Steve Clarke opted for a seat in the stand to watch players get some minutes in the legs.
The team was preparing for their opening Euro 2024 clash with Germany in Munich.
Post-Match Reflections: Scotland finally ended their seven-game winless run as they prepare to face Euro hosts Germany.
Leeds defender Liam Cooper limped from the fray with 12 minutes to play, just days after key striker Lyndon Dykes succumbed to an ankle injury.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Gibraltar are a combination of gnarled old pros and young thrusters.
The team ranked the second worst in Europe were never expected to give Scotland much of a game.
Others: The match was played at the Estadio Algarve in Faro, where Scotland had previously played Gibraltar eight years ago.
